result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
No violent or abusive contact with victim 1 in 20CM64
Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by Agent
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Costs to be paid through Probation
Credit = 22 days (if revoked)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Curtis

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of Prelim.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Marone received the information by email and it matches the complaint.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

03:14 PM Attorney Karen L. Marone appeared by phone means for Defendant Christopher L Curtis. Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher L Curtis appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
21CM64 tracking with 22CF12:
Atty Marone states that the matters are resolved and states plea agreement.  Court notes that the defendant needs to waive the prelim.   Atty Marone agrees.

  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom.

  Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1 in 22CF12.  Counts 2, 3, 4 & 21CM64 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Marone agrees.  Defendant agrees.

  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CF12 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date.
Counts 2, 3, 4 & 21CM64 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Marone makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Marone states that the defendant is looking into getting into drug court in Waushara County.

Atty Marone asks for expungment.  Atty Juech objects.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds that the defendant is not eligible for expungment due to his criminal history.


BY THE COURT:  Count 1, 22CF12:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $268.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1 in 20CM64
*Random drug and alcohol screens as recommended by the Agent
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Credit = 22 days (if revoked)
Costs to be paid through Probation
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Status hearing on February 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:52 AM Attorney Karen L. Marone appeared by phone means for Defendant Christopher L Curtis.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher L Curtis appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
21CM64 tracking with 22CF12:
  Atty Marone was just appointed and has not been able to speak with her client yet.  
Court will put parties into a breakout room.

11:05am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
  Atty Marone states that she and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaints in both matters & waives the readings.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in both cases.  Defendant understands.  
Atty Marone waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.  

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing in 22CF12
bond continued

Atty Marone enters a Not Guilty plea on 21CM64.  
BY THE COURT: Not Guilty plea entered on 21CM64

Atty Marone asks to argue the bond today.  
BY THE COURT:  set for status  Status hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Christopher L Curtis appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Defendant did contact the PD office.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant qualifies but they are appointing private bar.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on January 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:25 PM Defendant Christopher L Curtis appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get an attorney.

Atty Burdon requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Burdon states that the defendant has an active warrant on 21CM64 from July 2021.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Cash bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

BY THE COURT:  Court will reinstate the bond on 21CM64
Warrant quashed in 21CM64  Initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
